thread.title: Oman LNG to support national golf development squad programme
thread.title_full: Oman LNG to support national golf development squad programme

author: muscatdaily@apexmedia.co.om (Muscat Daily News)
title: Oman LNG to support national golf development squad programme
text:
Oman LNG to support national golf development squad programme Members of the national golf development squad with OGC and Oman LNG officials October 13, 2015 
The Oman Golf Committee (OGC) has received a fresh boost in its bid to develop and promote the sport among youngsters, with corporate giant Oman LNG coming forward to sponsor the national development squad programme. 
The OGC runs the development squad on the sidelines of its senior, junior and women's squads as part of its long-term mission to develop golf in Oman by nurturing young talent and forming a supply line. 
Mundhir al Barwani, the chairman of the OGC, welcomed Oman LNG’s support in promoting golf among Omani youngsters. 
“All along, the Ministry of Sports Affairs has been our biggest supporter when it comes developing young golfers. With that, now we have Oman LNG taking a keen interest in shaping Omani golf. With their support we want to create an environment that allows beginners in the development squad aspire to reach the top.” 
The OGC's development squad currently features 18 promising players in the age-group of 7-16 years. The players are pooled into three groups based on their skill levels - novice, intermediate and advanced. They regularly undergo training at Ghala Golf Club under PGA Pro coach Milo Breitenwisher. 
Harib al Kitani, the chief executive officer of Oman LNG, expressed happiness in extending his relationship with the OGC. He said, “We are more than happy to take up this responsibility. This development squad is growing very steadily and we want it to flourish.” Similar content
